titles.title: Wǝddase ʾamlak “Praise of God”/ ʾArganonä wǝddase “The Harp of Praise”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Wǝddase ʾamlak “Praise of God” (fols. 2ra-131vb) I-1) Monday’s prayer of Basil of Caesarea (fols. 2ra-16vb) I-2) Tuesday’s prayer of Efrem the Syrian (fols. 17ra-42ra) I-3) Wednesday’s prayer of Efrem the Syrian (fols. 42rb-62rb) I-4) Thursday’s prayer of John Saba (ʾArägawi Mänfäsawi) (fols. 62va-86vb) I-5) Friday’s prayer of Shenute (87ra-96rb) and Pachomius (fols. 96rb-104rb) I-6) Saturday’s prayer of Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 104va-117vb) I-7) Sunday’s prayer of Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 118ra-131vb) II) ʾArganonä wǝddase “The Harp of Praise” (fols. 132r-255ra) II-1) Monday (fols. 132ra-152rb) II-2) Tuesday (fols. 152va-172vb) II-3) Wednesday (fols. 173ra-193vb) II-4) Thursday (fols. 194ra-216rb) II-5) Friday (fols. 216va-234ra) II-6) Saturday (fols. 234rb-244rb) II-7) Sunday (fols. 244va-255ra)
Additiones 1-5.

donors.donor: The names of original donors (?) have been erased. Names of three individuals, Henok, Milkiyas, Wälättä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus are written over erasures in a secondary hand, in red, fols. 8rb, 9vab, 15vb, 17ra, 17vb, 19rb, 20rb, 21vab, 28rb, 28va, 29ra, 30rab, 33rb, 35vb, 36rb, 37vab, 39vab, 42va, 43rab, 43vb, 45rab, 49rb, etc.

owners.owner: The name of the original owner, the church of Mäqdäla Mädḫane ʿAläm, is written in the upper margin of fol. 2r.

txstates.txstate: The front board is missing. The back board is loosely attached to the textblock. The textblock is divided into two parts due to the damaged sewing between quires XVIII and XIX. Fol. 1 is mutilated, fol. 2 is discolored, cockled, its right margin is cut. Fol. 255 is mutilated. Some fols. are cockled, stained with water and with wax. (passages of the text on fols. 43rb and 101rab are hardly legible due to water damage). The spine shows concave distortion.

bindings.binding: Two leather boards (the front board is missing; the back board loose). Two pairs of sewing stations.

squires.squire:
I(11; s.l.: 1, stub after 11/fols. 1r-11v; two stubs between fols. 1 and 2) – ፪II(10/fols. 12r-21v) – ፫III(10/fols. 22r-31v) – ፬IV(10/fols. 32r-41v) – ፭V(10; s.l.: 5, stub after 5; 6, stub after 4/fols. 42r-51v) – ፮VI(10/fols. 52r-61v) – ፯VII(10/fols. 62r-72v) – ፰VIII(10; s.l.: 5, stub after 5; 6, stub after 4/fols. 73r-82v) – ፱IX(10; s.l.: 5, stub after 6; 6, stub after 5/fols. 83r-92v) – ፲X(10; s.l.: 5, stub after 6; 6, stub after 5/fols. 93r-102v) – ፲፩XI(10/fols. 103r-112v) – ፲፪XII(10/fols. 113r-122v) – ፲፫XIII(10/fols. 123r-132v) – ፲፬XIV(10/fols. 133r-142v) – ፲፭XV(10/fols. 143r-152v) – ፲፮XVI(10/fols. 153r-162v) – ፲፯XVII(10/fols. 163r-172v) – ፲፰XVIII(10/fols. 173r-182v) – ፲፱XIX(10/fols. 183r-192v) – ፳XX(8/fols. 193r-200v) – ፳፩XXI(10; s.l.: 5, stub after 5; 6, stub after 4/fols. 201r-210v) – ፳፪XXII(8;s.l.: 5, stub after 3; 4, stub after 4/fols. 211r-218v) – ፳፫XXIII(10/fols. 219r-228v) – ፳፬XXIV(10/fols. 229r-238v) – ፳፭XXV(10/fols. 239r-248v) – ፳፮XXVI(7; s.l.: 7, stub after 6/fols. 249r-255v).
The structure of the last quire is unclear. One bifolio (fols. 253-254) is an eccentric insertion into quire XXVI, between fols. 252 and 255.

taunit.mr-info: Text I (fols. 2r-131vb): all data for fol. 3r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible (not visible in e.g., fols. 18-27) The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Text II (fols. 132r-255r): all data for fol. 134r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible (not visible in e.g., fols. 18-27) Structural pricks are not visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Text II seems to be written in the same hand but with slightly bigger letters; angular.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; a few lines on the incipit page of the sections of Texts I and II; incipit of the subsections of Texts I and II; two lines of the concluding formula of Text I (fol. 131vb), supplication note (fol. 155ra), the Trinitarian formula (fol. 255ra); names of the days of the week written in the upper margin of Text I (fols. 2r, 17r, 42r, 62r, 87r, 104v, 118r) and Text II (fols.: 132r, 152v, 173r, 194r, 216v, 234rb, 244v); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. The names of the donors are rubricated with strong vermilion.

otherdetails.otherdetail: The parts of Text I (from I-1 to I-6) are divided into sections distinguished by means of rubrication of the first two lines and dividers. In contrast, in Ms. DD-023 the sections are called mǝʾǝraf.

additional.cont: Fol. 193vb: Supplication prayer to St. Mary.
additional.det: The prayer is written on behalf of Ḥenok in the same hand as the corrections for Text I.

additional.cont: Fol. 194r: Short supplication prayer to St. Mary.
additional.det: Probably written in the same hand as Texts I, II.

additional.cont: Fol. 216rb: Supplication prayer to St. Mary.
additional.det: The prayer is written on behalf of Ḥenok in the same hand as that of the corrections for Text I.

additional.cont: Fol. 234ra: Supplication prayer to St. Mary.
additional.det: The prayer is written on behalf of Ḥenok in the same hand as that of the corrections for Text I.

additional.cont: Fol. 244rb: Supplication prayer to St. Mary.
additional.det: The prayer is written on behalf of Ḥenok in the same hand as that of the corrections for Text I.

extras.extra: - Title of the book is written on the right board, ውዳሴ አምላክ “Praise of God”. - Title of the book and the name of the owning institution, the church of Mäqdäla Mädḫane ʿAläm, are written in the right upper corner of fol. 2r, ውዳሴ አምላክ ዘመድኃኔ፡ ዓለም “Praise of God” of Mädḫane ʿAläm. - Corrections to Text I are written interlineally, in the margins and over erasures, in a different hand: fols. 2rab, 3va, 4ra, 4va, 5ra, 6ra, 7vb, 9ra, 10vb, 11vab, 12va, 13rab, 13vab, 14va, 17va, 18va, 19rb, 20vb, 26r, 35rb, 36va, 45rb, 47vb, 51vb, 55va, 63ra, 67v, 72ra, 73ra, 73vb, 79vab, 80ra, 82rab, 87v, 90r, 99r, 105rb, 107ra, 110vb, 112va, 115va, 117va, 118rab, 119va, 123vb. - Extensive omitted passage of Text I (cf. Ms. DD-023, fol. 34va, ls.3-20) was later added by another scribe. He wrote it in the upper margin of fol. 30v and indicated the place of insertion with the tämälläs-sign (┴). - Tämälläs-signs indicating the place where the omissions, written in the upper margins, belong. Written by the same scribe who made corrections for Text I: fols. 3va l.21, 12vb l.11, 26ra l.6, 36va l.6, 45rb l.13, 67va l.2, 87vb l.4, 90ra l.7, 107ra l.4, 110vb l.5, 112va l.2, 123vb l.4. - Trinitarian formula is written in the same hand as that of corrections for Text I: fol. 255ra.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire marks are written in the upper margin: fols. 12r, 22r, 32r, 42r, 52r, 62r, 73r, 83r, 93r, 103r, 113r, 123r, 133r, 143r, 153r, 163r, 173r, 183r, 193r, 201r, 211r, 219r, 229r, 239r, 249r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Names of the days of the week are written in red ink, indicating the daily readings: fols. 2r, 17r, 42r, 62r, 87r, 104v, 118r (Text I); 132r, 152v, 173r, 194r, 216v, 234rb, 244v (Text II).

frames.frame: Fol. 255ra: Coloured (black and red) ornamental band; geometric motifs.
